content.description: Getting to this spire, actually all of the spires, one must first figure out the easiest way to the upper tier.  A variety of options exist.  The climbing on the actual route is easy with one or two pockets for tricams or cams.
content.protection: One bolt gets you down to the saddle between the West Maid and Middle Maid.
content.location: Scramble or possibly spelunk your way west to the obvious westernmost Maid.  There are two 90's style rappel/belay bolts to use for a quick traverse into the saddle between the Western Maid and the Middle Maid.

content.description: There are several ways to the summit of this broad Maid.  The easiest route is class 3+ or a probable 5.11 finger crack or a variety of other crack options. Your choice.  We opted for a nicely protected 5.5 crack on the west side of the formation since we rappelled down to this saddle from the Western Maid.  We also climbed a 5.6+ crack on the north face.
content.protection: Two bolts on the summit.  Small rack to #4 is more than enough.
content.location: Fairly easy to locate, it sits right in the middle of the formation and is the fattest Maid of the three.

content.description: An easy chimney to some stacked blocks leads to the window.  From stacked rocks do a quick scramble west and tag the Mini Maid, downclimb back to the window.  An easy scramble takes you to the top.  Lots of other moderately to difficult options also exist for your summit bid.
content.protection: Two bolts on summit.  One #4 or smaller. Rappel goes down north face.
content.location: Easternmost Maid with the very obvious natural window.

content.description: Perhaps some of the most solid rock in the Superstitions, this moderately sized crag has the potential for countless possibilities.  Although too much of something (crammed routes) is a bad thing, use wise judgment and enjoy the historical routes before your first ascent crazed mind tells you otherwise...
